derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English scunian 'abhor, shrink back with fear, seek safety from an enemy', of unknown origin

entry.def: If you shun someone or something, you deliberately avoid them or keep away from them.

example.ex: From that time forward everybody shunned him...
example.tran: 从那时候起，每个人都有意回避他。
他一直有意避开媒体的关注。

means.word_mean: 1. avoid and stay away from deliberately; stay clear of
2. expel from a community or group

auth_sentence.content: She says North Korea will shun his administration forever.
auth_sentence.res_content: She says North Korea will shun his administration forever.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: She says North Korea will shun his administration forever.

auth_sentence.content: They either play knowing the score or shun investing.
auth_sentence.res_content: They either play knowing the score or shun investing.

auth_sentence.content: They shun any need to impress with Life Less Ordinary.

means.word_mean: 避开, 回避, 避免

sentences.en: He was a shy man who shunned all publicity.
sentences.cn: 他是个怕羞的人, 总是避开一切引人注目的活动。

jushi.english: He is a person to be shunned.
jushi.chinese: 他是一个谁见着谁都躲避的人。
